intro: Cecropia caucana, commonly known as the cauca cea or cauca cecropia, is a fast-growing tree native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many species of stinging plants. The plant is characterized by its large, simple leaves and distinctive, clustered inflorescences. It is often found in disturbed habitats and is known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions. Cecropia caucana plays an important role in local ecosystems, providing food and shelter for various animals.
